subNodes.conversationText: root

<FirstName> found the source of the smell. The body of a young man was leaning against a natural pillar. His stomach had begun to rot away, but his head was still intact. His clothes -- fine clothes -- were stained with blood. He had a big gash in his neck.
<FirstName> was curious about the young man's identity. <He/She> looked carefully at his face and clothing.

He was in his mid-twenties, maybe, and had the look of someone who spent most of his life indoors. Though good-looking, he was slight, wispy. He wore an embroidered doublet and jerkin soiled through with blood and grime.
Witches tend to be less squeamish and more practical than other people. <FirstName> searched the body for valuables.
[Wisdom] How had this corpse come to be here? <FirstName> contemplated the clues.
[Wisdom] How had this corpse come to be here? <FirstName> contemplated the clues.
<FirstName> left the body.
Witches tend to be less squeamish and more practical than other people. <FirstName> searched the body for valuables.
He had no money on him, but <FirstName> did find a discordium-infused dagger in a sheath on his belt.
<He/She> took it.
On his finger was a ring. It had a thin gold band and one unfaceted, cloud-blue gem.
<He/She> took this, too. What good could the trinket do this corpse?
Pharaoh, meanwhile, had hopped closer to the corpse's entrails and was cocking his head and whining. He was hungry. <FirstName> shooed the bird away.
The young witch examined the young man's face and clothing.
[Wisdom] How had this corpse come to be here? <FirstName> contemplated the clues.
[Wisdom] How had this corpse come to be here? <FirstName> contemplated the clues.
<FirstName> left the body.
What good could this trinket do the young witch? <He/She> left it.
Pharaoh, meanwhile, had hopped closer to the corpse's entrails and was cocking his head and whining. He was hungry. <FirstName> shooed the bird away.
<He/She> didn't take it.
On his finger was a ring. It had a thin gold band and one unfaceted, cloud-blue gem.
[Wisdom] How had this corpse come to be here? <FirstName> contemplated the clues.
[Success] He'd had his throat cut before he fell into the hole, that much was clear.
[Continue.]
Meanwhile, the blood on the floor above suggested his body had been pushed or dragged to the hole and thrown in.
Still, <FirstName> concluded that he might not have been completely dead when he landed.
He was sitting against a pillar. He might have regained consciousness and rested against it as he bled out. He would have been too weak to look for an exit.
[Continue.]

More importantly, who killed this person and why?

Was the Congress of Moths responsible? If the old stories were true, the fairies took their prey to the roots of the world, to the feast halls of the Wooden Crone. The pit beneath the shack was deep, but not that deep.

Perhaps the hunter who killed Nnenne had other victims.
That meant he must have been dead when he landed.
Or so it seemed to the young witch, though that made it hard to explain how he ended up sitting against the pillar.
[Continue.]

More importantly, who killed this person and why?

Was the Congress of Moths responsible? If the old stories were true, the fairies took their prey to the roots of the world, to the feast halls of the Wooden Crone. The pit beneath the shack was deep, but not that deep.

Perhaps the hunter who killed Nnenne had other victims.
The witch was uncertain about the other details.

<FirstName> left the body.
[Failure] <FirstName> couldn't be sure and, after thinking it over, doubted that it mattered.
